intro: Peyrousia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered peyrousia, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense clusters of small, green leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with thick foliage that helps reduce water loss. Peyrousia fasciculata is often found in rocky soils and is resistant to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
